author: Daita Dasgupta
title: 'Good Friday' 2024; Quotes, Greetings, and WhatsApp status to send your loved ones
text:
Good Friday is an important day that is celebrated worldwide. It is a solemn day that commemorates the crucifixion of Lord Jesus Christ. People mourn the death of Christ and to honour and celebrate him, Christians observe fast and pray to Jesus and take part in several church activities. Christians believe that Jesus Christ died on the cross to atone for the sins committed by mankind and pave the road to redemption. Though the event was tragic, the outcome was good and thus the name Good Friday.
Good Friday falls on the Friday, before Easter Sunday. This year, Good Friday falls on March 29.
Here are some quotes, greetings and WhatsApp statuses that you can send to your near and dear ones.
‘Good Friday’ Quotes ‘We may say that on the first Good, Friday afternoon was completed that great act by which light conquered darkness and goodness conquered sin.” ( by Phillips Brooks)
“Good Friday is a day of sorrow mingled with joy. It is a time to grieve over the sin of man and to meditate and rejoice upon God’s love in giving His only Son for the redemption of sin.” ( by David Katski)
“The cross was two pieces of dead wood; and a helpless, unresisting Man was nailed to it; yet it was mightier than the world, and triumphed, and will ever triumph over it.” ( by Augustus William Hare)
‘Good Friday’ Greetings “Wishing you a meaningful Good Friday as we remember the sacrifice of Jesus Christ.”
“May the mercy and forgiveness of Jesus Christ guide you always. Have a blessed Good Friday.”
“Sending heartfelt wishes for a peaceful and reflective Good Friday.”
“May the cross of Jesus Christ be a symbol of hope and redemption in your life.”
“Wishing you a day of prayer, reflection, and spiritual renewal on Good Friday.”
‘Good Friday’ WhatsApp status “As we remember the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, let us reflect on His teachings of love and forgiveness. Wishing you a meaningful Good Friday.”
“May the solemnity of Good Friday remind us of the immense love and sacrifice of Jesus Christ. Have a blessed day filled with prayer and reflection.”
“On this Good Friday, may the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you, guiding you towards peace and salvation. Have a blessed day.”
“Wishing you a peaceful and reflective Good Friday. May the blessings of this holy day bring you closer to God’s eternal love and grace.”
“As we observe Good Friday, let us remember the immense love and sacrifice of Jesus Christ. Wishing you a blessed day of prayer and reflection.”

author: Matthew Hancock-Bruce
title: Met Office issues amber weather warning as snow expected to cause power cuts and travel chaos
text:
Met Office issues amber weather warning as snow expected to cause power cuts and travel chaos
An icy weekend could result in power cuts and travel disruption.
The Met Office has issued an amber weather warning for snow and freezing rain, covering the entirety of Cheshire East.
Motorists are being advised to stay off the roads, with delays likely and road closures possible as well.
"It is safer not to drive in these conditions, but if you need to make an essential journey, consider alternative forms of transport, to keep you and others safe," reads the Met Office website.
"If you must drive, do this more safely by: using dipped headlights; accelerating gently, using low revs and changing to higher gears as quickly as possible; starting in second gear to help with wheel slip; maintaining a safe and steady speed, keeping distance from other vehicles; using a low gear to go downhill, avoiding braking unless necessary; steering into skids, not taking your hands of the wheel, and avoiding slamming on brakes."
There is also a 'good chance' of power cuts, according to the Met Office.
The website adds: "People cope better with power cuts when they have prepared for them in advance. It's easy to do; consider gathering torches and batteries, a mobile phone power pack and other essential items.
"If isolated due to snow or ice, follow these simple steps to keep safe and well: keep the thermostat set to the same temperature both during the day and at night; turn off electrical heaters and put out your fire before going to bed; ensure pets are safe by keeping them warm and comfortable; prevent frozen pipes by opening kitchen and bathroom cabinet doors to allow warmer air to circulate around the plumbing; stay indoors, wrap up warm and close internal doors to keep the heat in; and, if you need support call the British Red Cross Support Line on 0808 196 3651.
"Help to protect vulnerable people that you know including older people, those with underlying conditions and those who live alone; they may need support with food and medical supplies. If you are worried about your health or that of somebody you know, ring NHS 111."
The amber weather warning comes into effect at 6pm on Saturday, December 4, and lasts until midday on Sunday, December 5.
There is expected to be 'persistent and heavy' snow along with a period of freezing rain.

author: Autor maillotballl maillotballl
title: Arsenal a subi une défaite surprise à domicile - futbolowo.pl
text: Arsenal a subi une défaite surprise à domicile Le 19e tour de Premier League se poursuit. Arsenal est assis à domicile pour relever le défi de West Ham United. Les supporters portant des [maillot Arsenal](https://cadeaumaillots.fr/Club-297/Arsenal-304)pendant la saison pensent qu'Arsenal, jouant à domicile, peut gagner ce match. A la 14e minute, le défenseur d'Arsenal a fait un gros cadeau non loin du sauvetage : Soucek a décoché une volée dans la surface de réparation et West Ham United a pris l'avantage 1-0. À la 41e minute, Odegaard a envoyé un ballon en profondeur. Saka a tiré fort du côté droit de la surface de réparation. Le ballon a touché le poteau et a rebondi. Arsenal a raté l'occasion d'égaliser. À la 55e minute, West Ham United a décoché un corner depuis la gauche. Mavropanos, qui portait un [tenues de foot pas cher](https://cadeaumaillots.fr/), a frappé la barre transversale avec sa tête et a rebondi dans le but. West Ham United a élargi son avance 2-0. A la 74e minute, Trossard s'est ajusté dans la surface de réparation et a volé sous un petit angle. Le ballon a été bloqué par le gardien de West Ham United. Dans les arrêts de jeu, Rice a commis une faute dans la surface de réparation et Benrahma a tiré le penalty, qui a été sauvé par Raya. En fin de match, Arsenal a perdu 0-2 contre West Ham United à domicile, subissant sa première défaite à domicile de la saison. Arsenal, qui a perdu ce match, a quand même accumulé 40 points et a raté l'occasion de dépasser Liverpool et de revenir en tête du classement. West Ham United a marqué les 3 points clés et a dépassé Manchester United pour se hisser à la sixième place du classement avec 33 points.

author: Parthasarathi Biswas
title: July starts on a good note, Pune district has received twice the normal rainfall till date
text:
Click hereto join
Express Pune WhatsApp channeland get a curated list of our stories
Pune district has recorded more than twice its normal rainfall since the start of the monsoon, with the India Meteorological Department (IMD) noting 449 mm of rain so far against a normal of 275.1 mm. July too has begun on a good note, with 117.6 mm of rain reported so far, as compared to the normal of 83 mm for the month.
A key feature of this month’s showers is the near-continuous rainfall, with relatively few instances of intense, heavy, or very heavy spells. As per IMD parameters, heavy rainfall is defined as 64.5–115.5 mm in 24 hours, while very heavy rainfall ranges from 115.6–204.4 mm. An intense spell is one where 90 per cent of the day’s rain falls within an hour.
The consistent rains have helped improve water storage in dams across the district. Pavana dam, which supplies water to Pimpri-Chinchwad, is now at 67.67 per cent of its capacity, up sharply from 20.30 per cent this time last year. Khadakwasla is at 56.82 per cent (53.15 per cent last year), Panshet at 68.63 per cent (31.31), Warasgaon at 73.52 per cent (19.14), and Temghar at 61.96 per cent (18.56).
Overall, the 22 dams in Pune district are now at 87.38 per cent of their collective capacity, compared to 76.83 per cent last year.
With rising storage, controlled discharge has begun into several rivers, including the Pavana, Mutha, and Indrayani, contributing to higher water levels downstream at Ujjani dam.
